Terms of use and services In order to be allowed to use Pocket Code and other executables offered by the Catrobat project, you must agree to our Terms of use and services and strictly follow them when you use Pocket Code and our other executables. Please see the link below for their precise formulation.\n Terms of Use and services
Pocket Code terms of use and services You attempt to use Pocket Code together with Parrot\'s AR.Drone. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s terms of use and services for the drone and to Catrobat\'s terms of use for Pocket Code. Do not remind me again.
About Pocket Code Pocket Code is a programming environment and interpreter for Android devices for the visual programming language Catrobat.\n\n The source code of Pocket Code is mainly licensed under the GNU AGPL v3 License. For further details on the license see the link below.\n Pocket Code Source Code License About Catrobat

The following components are unavailable:\n\n \u2022 Flash\n \u2022 Vibrator\n \u2022 Acceleration sensor\n \u2022 Inclination sensor\n \u2022 Compass\n \u2022 GPS\n \u2022 Text-To-Speech engine\n \u2022 Back facing camera\n \u2022 Facedetection\n \u2022 Front facing camera\n \u2022 Unknown component\n NFC not available Please activate NFC and press Back to return to the application! Battery is low. Current status = (Your Program will be renamed.) Size: Upload Upload program Description: Choose up to three categories Battery is low (automatic landing). One or more camera(s) is not responding. Ultrasound sensor is not responding. AR.Drone euler angles went too high. Motors shutdown to prevent bad behaviors. One or more motor(s) was stopped by environment. Battery is too low to take-off again. Ultrasound sensor can\'t determine AR.Drone altitude. No speed estimation from bottom facing camera. Emergency

NXT Sensor Configuration Disable Info Dialog Program specific NXT settings are not shown when opening a program. The mapping of NXT sensors to ports is program specific and can only be configured for opened programs! The selection of drone configuration properties is program specific and can only be configured within the program. The current program uses Lego Mindstorms NXT bricks or sensors. For proper functionality please connect the sensors to the robot as follows Port 1 Port 2 Port 3 Port 4 Do not show this message again. Do you want to overwrite the Sensor on the chosen port? Overwrite sensor?
EV3 Sensor Configuration Program specific EV3 settings are not shown when opening a program. The mapping of EV3 sensors to ports is program specific and can only be configured for opened programs! The current program uses Lego Mindstorms EV3 bricks or sensors. For proper functionality please connect the sensors to the robot as follows

Merging not possible
Variable %1$s is used in both programs. If programs use the same variable name they cannot be merged. Please rename the variable in one of the programs and try again.
List %1$s is used in both programs. If programs use the same name for their lists they cannot be merged. Please rename the list in one of the programs and try again.

Rate Pocket Code If you enjoy Pocket Code, please rate us on Google Play! Now Later Never
Warning! Deleting a variable that is still in use is dangerous! Are you sure? Yes, delete anyway! No.
Your program gets uploaded to our community page where others can use and download it. You can also download your program as standalone app. Show program
Got it Enable to show hints Show hints All bricks are sorted in categories. Choose the category you are looking for. To add a brick to your script tap on the brick you want to use. Short tap on a brick opens the menu to move, copy, delete or add a brick to the backpack. The help option will show you additional information. Drag and drop the brick with a long press. The script defines the behaviour of your object. To add bricks to the script tap on the "+" symbol. Here you can find the different appearances of your object. To add a new look tap on the "+" symbol. Here you can add new sounds to your object. Keep in mind to use a brick from the sound category. Your program consists of different objects that can interact with each other. To add a new object tap on the "+" symbol. To merge two programs long press on one program to open the menu and tap on \'Merge with\'. Hit the back-button to pause your program. To show axes and the screen size of your phone tap "Axes on". A program can consist of different independent scenes. To add a new scene tap on the "+" symbol.
Pocket Code has crashed! Please help to improve Pocket Code by sending us anonymous crash reports! Always send Send
